section.title: Introduction
section.subsection: By terms of the 1960 Treaty of Establishment that created the independent Republic of Cyprus, the UK retained full sovereignty and jurisdiction over two areas of almost 254 square kilometers - Akrotiri and Dhekelia. The larger of these is the Dhekelia Sovereign Base Area, which is also referred to as the Eastern Sovereign Base Area.

section.title: Geography
section.subsection: Eastern Mediterranean, on the southeast coast of Cyprus near Famagusta
Middle East
131 sq km area surrounds three Cypriot enclavescountry comparison to the world: 222
about three-quarters the size of Washington, DC
temperate; Mediterranean with hot, dry summers and cool winters

British extraterritorial rights also extended to several small off-post sites scattered across Cyprus; several small Cypriot enclaves exist within the Sovereign Base Area (SBA); of the SBA land, 60% is privately owned and farmed, 20% is owned by the Ministry of Defense, and 20% is SBA Crown land

section.title: People and Society
section.subsection: approximately 15,500 on the Sovereign Base Areas of Akrotiri and Dhekelia including 9,700 Cypriots and 5,800 Service and UK-based contract personnel and dependents

subsection.title: Children under the age of 5 years underweight

section.subsection: NA

section.title: Environment
section.subsection: netting and trapping of small migrant songbirds in the spring and autumn
temperate; Mediterranean with hot, dry summers and cool winters

section.title: Government
section.subsection: a special form of UK overseas territory; administered by an administrator who is also the Commander, British Forces Cyprus

subsection.title: Capital
subsection.note: Episkopi Cantonment (base administrative center for Akrotiri and Dhekelia); located in Akrotiri
UTC+2 (7 hours ahead of Washington, DC, during Standard Time)
+1hr, begins last Sunday in March; ends last Sunday in October
"Episkopi" means "episcopal" in Greek and stems from the fact that the site previously served as the bishop's seat of an Orthodox diocese

subsection.title: Constitution
subsection.note: presented 3 August 1960, effective 16 August 1960 (The Sovereign Base Areas of Akrotiri and Dhekelia Order in Council 1960, serves as a basic legal document); amended 1966

section.subsection: laws applicable to the Cypriot population are, as far as possible, the same as the laws of the Republic of Cyprus; note - the Sovereign Base Area Administration has its own court system to deal with civil and criminal matters

subsection.title: Executive branch
subsection.note: Administrator Air Vice-Marshal Peter J.M. SQUIRES (since 1 September 2022); note - the administrator reports to the British Ministry of Defense and is also Commander, British Forces Cyprus (BFC); the chief officer, an appointed civilian, is responsible for the day-to-day running of the civil government of the Sovereign Base Areas
the monarchy is hereditary; administrator appointed by the monarch on the advice of the Ministry of Defense

subsection.title: Judicial branch
subsection.note: Senior Judges' Court (consists of several visiting judges from England and Wales)

note.title: judge selection and term of office

section.subsection: none (overseas territory of the UK)
none (overseas territory of the UK)
the flag of the UK is used

subsection.title: National anthem
subsection.note: as a United Kingdom area of special sovereignty, "God Save the King" is official (see United Kingdom)

section.title: Economy
section.subsection: none

section.title: Communications
section.subsection: British Forces Broadcast Service (BFBS) provides multi-channel satellite TV service as well as BFBS radio broadcasts to the Dhekelia Sovereign Base

section.title: Military and Security
section.subsection: defense of Dhekelia (aka Eastern Sovereign Base Area) is the responsibility of the UK; includes Dhekelia Garrison and Ayios Nikolaos Station connected by a roadway
